main event: On 6 March 1967, a witness observed a bright unidentified aerial object in Tawas, Michigan.
interesting points: The object was described as brighter and larger than surrounding planets,It exhibited red and white colors.,The object made no noise during the sighting.,The duration of the observation was around 10 minutes.,The case was classified as unidentified and possible 'AURORA.'
witness description: Two residents, including a father and child, reported seeing the object.
